intro: Tulipa clusiana var. rubroalba, commonly known as the red-veined tulip, is a striking perennial bulbous plant native to Turkey. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers with deep red petals and prominent white veins, creating a bold visual contrast. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge in early spring. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its adaptability to well-drained soils.
